title: Kyle Sinckler and his mum-pleasing try epitomised the enterprising and spirited victory England needed - and one they delivered
text:
It was Kyle Sinckler’s mum, Donna, who decided his “physicality” was a problem on a football pitch and took him aged eight to Battersea Ironsides rugby club. So it seems right that she was in Oita 18 years later to see her son score his first try in Test rugby.

“I saw her in the crowd. She was pretty emotional,” Sinckler said. “It’s been a long, long journey for me and her.” For a tight-head prob, it was a long journey too from where Owen Farrell threw him the ball for him to burst through Australia’s defence. “I was knackered afterwards,’ Sinckler said. “I said to Faz [Farrell] - take the minute and a half [for the conversion] because I needed the rest. That was a tough, tough Test match.”...
description: It was Kyle Sinckler’s mum, Donna, who decided his “physicality” was a problem on a football pitch and took him aged eight to Battersea Ironsides rugby club.
